Pre-Game Insights: Manolo Márquez emphasized the importance of possession-based attacking football.
Márquez anticipates a challenging match, with the title in sight.
Márquez prefers to play a good game than to win the tournament.
José Lana, Syria's head coach, anticipates a challenging task, having closely analyzed the Blue Tigers' playing style under Márquez.
Lana thinks India are a great team, and they try to move the ball fast.
Lana believes India have good organization, they know how to play when they don't have the ball, and they try to press high.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Blue Tigers dominated possession and registered more attempts on goal against Mauritius.
The upcoming game between India and Syria is virtually the final.
India and Syria have shared an intense rivalry since their first meeting at the Nehru Cup in 2007.
India suffered a narrow 1-0 loss to Syria in their recent faceoff at the AFC Asian Cup in January.
The GMC Balayogi Athletic Stadium will host the crucial tie between India and Syria on September 9, 2024.
Others: Jay Gupta expressed his delight at having the Spaniard as the national team's head coach, having previously played under him in the ISL.
Gupta said the atmosphere in the dressing room is really, really positive, and they believe in what Manolo asks.
